title: Fix oldest-cursor bulk fetch logic — use per-project incremental cursors
description:
## Problem

In lib/huly/HulyFetchService.js lines 92-98, the bulk fetch uses the OLDEST sync cursor across all projects as modifiedSince. If one project is stale (2 hours), ALL projects re-fetch 2 hours of history.

### Example:
- Project A cursor: 10 min ago, Project B: 2 hours, Project C: 5 min
- Result: ALL three fetch 2 hours of data (Project B wins)

## Fix

Use per-project cursors or group projects by cursor age. Fall back to individual fetches for projects with very different cursor ages.

## Files to modify
- lib/huly/HulyFetchService.js (lines 92-115)

## Verification
- npx vitest run tests/unit/HulyService.test.js

title: [Epic] CodePerceptionModule - Real-Time Knowledge Graph Syncer
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-891

## Objective

Implement a real-time Code Perception module that watches local project codebases, indexes changes, and pushes structural/semantic definitions to the Graphiti Knowledge Graph.

## Problem

The Graphiti Knowledge Graph becomes stale immediately after code changes. Agents querying the graph for 'Project Architecture' get outdated answers, leading to hallucinations during development tasks.

## Solution

Integrate a Real-Time Code Watcher into VibeSync that:

1. Watches file events (chokidar)
2. Parses code using Tree-sitter (via CocoIndex patterns)
3. Performs atomic upserts to Graphiti EntityNodes representing the code

## Graphiti API Endpoints (Confirmed LIVE)

- `POST /entity-node` - Create/upsert file or symbol entities
- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update existing node summaries
- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Soft-delete removed files
- `GET /api/utils/uuid` - Deterministic UUID generation
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Edge UUID generation
- `POST /messages` - Add narrative context (commit messages)

## Implementation Phases

1. GraphitiClient adapter (lib/GraphitiClient.js)
2. CodePerceptionWatcher service (lib/CodePerceptionWatcher.js)
3. Configuration and integration
4. Testing and validation

## Success Metrics

- Graph reflects code changes within <5 seconds of file save
- Agent can answer questions about new code immediately
- Zero race conditions during rapid editing

title: Reduce ProjectSyncWorkflow over-fetching — skip full Vibe task fetch when prefetched
description:
## Problem

In temporal/workflows/project-sync.ts lines 277-283, when prefetched Huly issues are available (from webhook), the workflow still fetches ALL Vibe tasks via fetchProjectData(). If a webhook delivered 5 changed issues, we fetch all 500 tasks unnecessarily.

Secondary issue: batch parallelism defaults to 5, could be 20+ for webhook-triggered syncs.

## Fix

1. When prefetchedIssues available, only fetch corresponding Vibe tasks (or skip if not needed)
2. Increase batch size for webhook-triggered syncs

## Files to modify
- temporal/workflows/project-sync.ts (lines 277-300)
- temporal/activities/orchestration-projects.ts (possibly add filtered fetch)

Default excludes:

 — comma-separated glob patterns appended to defaults.

title: Implement GraphitiClient.js adapter for Graphiti API
description:
## Task
Create a GraphitiClient adapter class that provides methods for all Graphiti API operations needed by CodePerceptionModule.

## API Endpoints to Implement

### Entity Operations
- `POST /entity-node` - Upsert entity (file or symbol)
  - Required fields: `uuid`, `group_id`, `name`, `summary`
  - Name normalization happens server-side (`File:src/main.py` → `file_src_main_py`)

### UUID Utilities
- `GET /api/utils/uuid?name=X&group_id=Y` - Pre-calculate deterministic UUID
  - Algorithm: UUID5 with namespace `graphiti.entity.{group_id}`
  - Same name + group_id always produces same UUID
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Calculate edge UUID

### Node Updates
- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update node summary only
  - Lighter weight than full entity-node upsert

### Maintenance
- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Invalidate deleted files
  - Pass `group_id` and `active_files` array
  - Files NOT in array get marked with `invalid_at` timestamp

### Context (Optional)
- `POST /messages` - Add commit messages as narrative context

## Proposed Interface
```javascript
class GraphitiClient {
  constructor(baseUrl, groupId) {}
  
  // UUID utilities
  async getEntityUUID(name) {}
  async getEdgeUUID(sourceUuid, targetUuid, name) {}
  
  // Entity operations  
  async upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary) {}
  async updateNodeSummary(uuid, summary) {}
  
  // Maintenance
  async pruneDeletedFiles(activeFilePaths) {}
  
  // Context
  async addCommitMessage(message) {}
}
```

## Implementation Notes
- Use existing http.js connection pooling (fetchWithPool)
- Follow pattern from HulyRestClient.js
- Add retry logic for transient failures
- Include batch support for bulk operations (git checkout scenario)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All methods implemented and tested
- [ ] Connection pooling configured
- [ ] Error handling with retries
- [ ] JSDoc documentation

title: Test and validate CodePerceptionModule integration with Graphiti
description:
## Task
End-to-end testing of the CodePerceptionModule integration with Graphiti API.

## Test Scenarios

### 1. Single File Operations
- [ ] Create new file → Entity created in Graphiti
- [ ] Modify file → Summary updated
- [ ] Delete file → File marked invalid via prune-missing

### 2. UUID Consistency
- [ ] Verify client-side UUID matches server `/api/utils/uuid` endpoint
- [ ] Same file always produces same UUID
- [ ] Different group_id produces different UUID

### 3. Debounce Behavior
- [ ] Rapid saves (within 2s) only trigger one sync
- [ ] Final state is synced correctly

### 4. Burst Protection (git checkout)
- [ ] Simulate 100+ file changes at once
- [ ] Verify batching works (chunks of 50)
- [ ] Single prune-missing call at end

### 5. Hash Delta Check
- [ ] Unchanged file (same content) skips API call
- [ ] Changed content triggers update

### 6. Error Handling
- [ ] Graphiti API down → Graceful degradation
- [ ] Retry on transient failures
- [ ] No data loss on temporary failures

## Dry Run Mode
Add `--dry-run` mode that:
- Logs what WOULD be sent
- Verifies UUIDs via util endpoint
- Does not mutate Graphiti state

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All test scenarios pass
- [ ] Dry run mode works
- [ ] Performance: <5s from file save to graph update
- [ ] No race conditions under stress test

Definition

title: Add vendor/dependency exclusion filters to AST sync pipeline
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-917

## Problem

AST sync is pushing vendor/dependency files to Graphiti, creating ~23K noise nodes (~69% of GRAPH project nodes). This caused FalkorDB OOM crash (4G → 7.2G memory) and degrades search quality.

## Root Cause

No exclusion patterns in the file discovery or AST parsing pipeline. Every file in the project directory gets synced, including `node_modules/`, `vendor/`, `dist/`, etc.

## Solution

### 1. Add exclusion patterns to file discovery

Default excludes:

```
node_modules/
vendor/
static/vendor/
__pycache__/
.git/
dist/
build/
.next/
.nuxt/
*.min.js
*.bundle.js
*.map
```

### 2. Configurable via env var

`AST_EXCLUDE_PATTERNS` — comma-separated glob patterns appended to defaults.

### 3. Cleanup script

Provide a script or entity UUID list for purging existing vendor nodes from FalkorDB.

## Impact

- ~50% reduction in Graphiti memory usage
- Eliminates search noise from vendor code
- Fixes OOM risk at current scale

## Reported by

Graphiti KG team (cross-project)

title: Extract API routes to routes/ folder
Implement GraphitiClient.js adapter for Graphiti API
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-890

## Task

Create a GraphitiClient adapter class that provides methods for all Graphiti API operations needed by CodePerceptionModule.

## API Endpoints to Implement

### Entity Operations

- `POST /entity-node` - Upsert entity (file or symbol)
  - Required fields: `uuid`, `group_id`, `name`, `summary`
  - Name normalization happens server-side (`File:src/main.py` → `file_src_main_py`)

### UUID Utilities

- `GET /api/utils/uuid?name=X&group_id=Y` - Pre-calculate deterministic UUID
  - Algorithm: UUID5 with namespace `graphiti.entity.{group_id}`
  - Same name + group_id always produces same UUID
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Calculate edge UUID

### Node Updates

- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update node summary only
  - Lighter weight than full entity-node upsert

### Maintenance

- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Invalidate deleted files
  - Pass `group_id` and `active_files` array
  - Files NOT in array get marked with `invalid_at` timestamp

### Context (Optional)

- `POST /messages` - Add commit messages as narrative context

## Proposed Interface

```javascript
class GraphitiClient {
  constructor(baseUrl, groupId) {}
  
  // UUID utilities
  async getEntityUUID(name) {}
  async getEdgeUUID(sourceUuid, targetUuid, name) {}
  
  // Entity operations  
  async upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary) {}
  async updateNodeSummary(uuid, summary) {}
  
  // Maintenance
  async pruneDeletedFiles(activeFilePaths) {}
  
  // Context
  async addCommitMessage(message) {}
}
```

## Implementation Notes

- Use existing http.js connection pooling (fetchWithPool)
- Follow pattern from HulyRestClient.js
- Add retry logic for transient failures
- Include batch support for bulk operations (git checkout scenario)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All methods implemented and tested
- [ ] Connection pooling configured
- [ ] Error handling with retries
- [ ] JSDoc documentation

title: Add expression block anti-slop guard for PM agents
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-920

Add a dedicated expression memory block to all PM agents as an anti-slop guard.

**What**: A separate Letta memory block (label: 'expression') that defines communication style and explicitly bans AI slop patterns.

**Why**: PM persona already has behavioral rules ('NEVER say no rush') but they're buried in 5KB of text. A dedicated expression block makes anti-slop enforcement explicit and enforceable. Inspired by letta-ai/lettabot's persona_expression.mdx pattern.

**Design**:

- Shared base block: anti-slop rules all agents get (no 'certainly!', no 'great question!', no performative warmth)
- Per-agent personality layer: PM agents get terse/action-oriented style, companion agents get different style
- Apply to all PM agents first via control agent sync

**Implementation**:

1. Add expression block content builder in LettaMemoryBuilders.js
2. Add 'expression' to upsertMemoryBlocks call in SyncOrchestrator.js
3. Sync to all PM agents via control agent

**Estimate**: ~2h
**PM Decision**: Accepted P1 — shared base + per-agent overrides.

title: Batch issue processing (replace per-issue sequential awaits) with concurrency-limited pool

comments.author: vibesync
comments.text:
## Problem

Many sync operations are done per-issue sequentially (await per item), sometimes with added delays. This creates high wall time.

## Scope

- Identify per-issue loops in Phase 1/2 and Phase 3.
- Map API calls per issue (Huly update, Vibe update, Beads operations).

## Proposal

- Introduce a concurrency-limited worker pool (e.g., p-limit style) and process in chunks.
- Ensure ordering where required (status transitions, parent/child).

## Acceptance Criteria

- Large projects sync significantly faster.
- No increased mismatch/duplication.
- Rate limits respected.

## Risks

- API throttling / race conditions.

## Test Plan

- Implement pool with configurable concurrency.
- Run sync on known large dataset; compare timing.
- Validate counts match (issues created/updated) vs baseline.

title: Add idle-data timeout to matrix-client SSE streaming
description: The matrix-client SSE streaming to Letta has no idle-data timeout. LETTA_STREAMING_TIMEOUT=3600s is a total timeout, but if the Letta agent hangs (sends keepalive pings but zero data chunks), the connection stays open indefinitely, locking the room for all subsequent messages. Need: (1) idle data timeout ~120s - if no real data chunk arrives for N seconds, cancel and unlock room. (2) Log the cancellation for tracking which agents hang. Root cause discovered during PM work loop testing - room was stuck for ~1h48m.

title: [BUG] Bidirectional sync creates duplicate issues - Huly issues not visible in Beads
description:
## Problem

When syncing bidirectionally between Beads and Huly, duplicate issues are being created. This indicates that Huly→Beads sync is failing to import existing issues, causing Beads to create new entries for work that already exists in Huly.

## Evidence (from GRAPH project)

| Beads Created | Already Existed | Title | Status |
|---------------|-----------------|-------|--------|
| GRAPH-132 | GRAPH-101 | [P2] Update mutation paths to set updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-134 | GRAPH-104 | [P2] Update DeltaTracker to use timestamps | Done |
| GRAPH-135 | GRAPH-102 | [P2] Add FalkorDB index on updated_at | Done |
| GRAPH-136 | GRAPH-100 | [P2] Create migration script for existing nodes | Done |
| GRAPH-131 | GRAPH-103 | [P2] Implement incremental fetch in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-129 | GRAPH-106 | [P3] Implement Redis Stream consumer in visualizer | Done |
| GRAPH-130 | GRAPH-105 | [P3] Create ChangeEventPublisher class | Done |
| GRAPH-128 | GRAPH-107 | [P3] Integrate publisher into Graphiti mutation paths | Done |

## Root Cause Analysis

Possible causes:
1. Huly→Beads sync failure - Original issues never made it to Beads
2. Beads deduplication failure - Beads received Huly issues but didn't recognize them
3. ID/linking mismatch - Sync not maintaining proper cross-references
4. Timing issue - Beads tasks created before Huly sync completed

## Expected Behavior

- Issues created in Huly should appear in Beads via bd list
- When Beads syncs to Huly, it should check for existing issues
- No duplicate issues should be created

## Suggested Fix

1. Investigate Huly→Beads sync to ensure issues are imported correctly
2. Add deduplication check before creating new Huly issues from Beads
3. Compare issue titles/descriptions to find potential matches
4. If match found (especially if Done), link instead of create new

Beads Issue: huly-vibe-sync-ego

title: Cap WebhookDebouncer buffer to prevent memory leaks during high webhook traffic
description:
## Problem

WebhookDebouncer._pendingChanges (lib/webhook/WebhookDebouncer.js line 23) grows without limit. The buffer() method (line 37) pushes all incoming changes and only flushes after the debounce window (5000ms default).

During high webhook traffic (bulk imports, database migrations, webhook storms), hundreds of changes could accumulate before a single flush, consuming significant memory.

### Current code (lines 36-48):
```js
buffer(changes) {
  this._pendingChanges.push(...changes);  // No size limit
  if (this._debounceTimer) clearTimeout(this._debounceTimer);
  this._debounceTimer = setTimeout(() => this.flush(), this._debounceWindowMs);
}
```

Note: There IS a maxBatchSize (50) check at flush time (line 72), but it DISCARDS the oversized batch instead of splitting it — meaning large bursts lose data silently.

## Fix

1. Add emergency flush when buffer exceeds a hard cap (new _maxBufferSize param, default 500)
2. Change oversized batch behavior at flush to split into chunks instead of discarding
3. Add constructor param: maxBufferSize (default 500)

## Files to modify
- lib/webhook/WebhookDebouncer.js (buffer method + flush method + constructor)

## Verification
- npx vitest run tests/unit/HulyWebhookHandler.test.js

title: Replace hardcoded webhook IPs with Docker service names
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-923

## Problem

huly-change-watcher webhook URL was hardcoded to a stale Docker bridge IP (172.17.50.1). All webhook deliveries were timing out — real-time event pipeline was completely broken. Only 10-minute polling interval was active.

Fixed manually by updating IP, but this will break again on any Docker network change.

## Solution

Replace hardcoded IPs with Docker service names in all webhook/callback URLs. Docker DNS resolves service names to current container IPs automatically.

## Scope

- Audit all hardcoded IPs in docker-compose files and env configs
- Replace with Docker service names where containers are on the same Docker network
- For cross-network communication, use host.docker.internal or a stable DNS entry

## Files to audit

- /opt/stacks/huly-test-v07/docker-compose.yml (line 530 — already patched)
- Any .env files with webhook URLs
- vibesync config referencing external services by IP

title: Test and validate CodePerceptionModule integration with Graphiti
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-893

## Task

End-to-end testing of the CodePerceptionModule integration with Graphiti API.

## Test Scenarios

### 1. Single File Operations

- [ ] Create new file → Entity created in Graphiti
- [ ] Modify file → Summary updated
- [ ] Delete file → File marked invalid via prune-missing

### 2. UUID Consistency

- [ ] Verify client-side UUID matches server `/api/utils/uuid` endpoint
- [ ] Same file always produces same UUID
- [ ] Different group_id produces different UUID

### 3. Debounce Behavior

- [ ] Rapid saves (within 2s) only trigger one sync
- [ ] Final state is synced correctly

### 4. Burst Protection (git checkout)

- [ ] Simulate 100+ file changes at once
- [ ] Verify batching works (chunks of 50)
- [ ] Single prune-missing call at end

### 5. Hash Delta Check

- [ ] Unchanged file (same content) skips API call
- [ ] Changed content triggers update

### 6. Error Handling

- [ ] Graphiti API down → Graceful degradation
- [ ] Retry on transient failures
- [ ] No data loss on temporary failures

## Dry Run Mode

Add `--dry-run` mode that:

- Logs what WOULD be sent
- Verifies UUIDs via util endpoint
- Does not mutate Graphiti state

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All test scenarios pass
- [ ] Dry run mode works
- [ ] Performance: <5s from file save to graph update
- [ ] No race conditions under stress test

title: Implement CodePerceptionWatcher.js - Real-time code file watcher
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-892

## Task

Create a CodePerceptionWatcher service that watches project files and syncs structural/semantic data to Graphiti.

## Architecture

```
FileWatcher (chokidar)
    → Debounce (2s)
    → Parse & Extract (Tree-sitter/regex)
    → Hash Delta Check
    → GraphitiClient API Calls:
        • POST /entity-node (new files/symbols)
        • PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary (updates)
        • POST /api/tools/prune-missing (deletes)
```

## Implementation Details

### File Watching

- Extend existing FileWatcher.js pattern
- Use chokidar for file system events
- Debounce 2s to ensure writes are complete
- Respect .gitignore patterns

### Code Parsing

Phase 1: Simple file-level entities

- Entity name: `File:{relative_path}`
- Summary: First N chars of file + language detection

Phase 2 (Future): Symbol extraction

- Parse classes, functions using Tree-sitter
- Create `Symbol:{name}` entities
- Create DEFINES edges from File → Symbol

### Hash Delta Check

- Compute MD5 hash of file content
- Compare with previous sync state
- Skip unchanged files (avoid redundant API calls)

### Burst Protection

- Batch changes during git checkout (1000+ files)
- Chunk POST /entity-node calls (batches of 50)
- Single POST /api/tools/prune-missing at end

## Event Flow

1. Developer saves `src/user_manager.py`
2. chokidar fires FILE_MODIFIED event
3. Wait 2s debounce
4. Parse file, extract summary
5. Check hash - if changed:
   a. Compute UUID: `getEntityUUID('File:src/user_manager.py')`
   b. Call `upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary)`
6. On file delete:
   a. Collect active files
   b. Call `pruneDeletedFiles(activeFiles)`

## Configuration

```javascript
{
  graphiti: {
    enabled: process.env.GRAPHITI_ENABLED === 'true',
    apiUrl: process.env.GRAPHITI_API_URL || 'http://localhost:8003',
    groupId: process.env.GRAPHITI_GROUP_ID, // e.g., 'vibesync_project_huly-vibe-sync'
  },
  codePerception: {
    debounceMs: 2000,
    batchSize: 50,
    maxFileSizeKb: 500,
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] File add/change/delete events processed correctly
- [ ] Debouncing works (2s window)
- [ ] Hash delta check prevents redundant syncs
- [ ] Burst protection handles git checkout
- [ ] Integration with GraphitiClient works end-to-end

title: Fix stuck SyncFromVibeWorkflow retrying 'Vibe task not found'
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-924

## Problem

Temporal worker has a stuck `SyncFromVibeWorkflow` retrying the same 'Vibe task not found' error for hours. This is consuming worker resources and polluting logs.

## Root Cause

Likely a Vibe Kanban task was deleted or its ID changed, but the workflow still holds the old reference. The retry policy has no terminal failure condition for 'not found' errors.

## Solution

- Add non-retryable error classification for 404/not-found responses in Vibe sync activities
- Terminate the stuck workflow via Temporal CLI or UI
- Add max retry cap or exponential backoff ceiling to prevent infinite retry loops

## Immediate Action

Terminate the stuck workflow manually.

title: Add expression block anti-slop guard for PM agents
description:
Add a dedicated expression memory block to all PM agents as an anti-slop guard.

**What**: A separate Letta memory block (label: 'expression') that defines communication style and explicitly bans AI slop patterns.

**Why**: PM persona already has behavioral rules ('NEVER say no rush') but they're buried in 5KB of text. A dedicated expression block makes anti-slop enforcement explicit and enforceable. Inspired by letta-ai/lettabot's persona_expression.mdx pattern.

**Design**:
- Shared base block: anti-slop rules all agents get (no 'certainly!', no 'great question!', no performative warmth)
- Per-agent personality layer: PM agents get terse/action-oriented style, companion agents get different style
- Apply to all PM agents first via control agent sync

**Implementation**:
1. Add expression block content builder in LettaMemoryBuilders.js
2. Add 'expression' to upsertMemoryBlocks call in SyncOrchestrator.js
3. Sync to all PM agents via control agent

**Estimate**: ~2h
**PM Decision**: Accepted P1 — shared base + per-agent overrides.

title: Refactor AGENTS.md generation into composable AgentsMdGenerator module
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-910 ## Summary Replace hardcoded AGENTS.md template generation (currently split across LettaService.js and BeadsService.js) with a dedicated composable `AgentsMdGenerator` module using external templates and section registry. ## Problems Solved - Templates hardcoded inline in two different service files - Duplicate Beads CLI instructions in both templates - No way to customize per-project without editing source code - Every project gets identical instructions regardless of context ## Design Based on research of Clavix OSS patterns (DocInjector, marker-based blocks, config-driven adapters). ### Composable Sections

Section

Marker

Purpose

project-info

Project name, identifier, repo, filesystem path

beads-instructions

Beads CLI usage, issue lifecycle

session-completion

What to do when finishing a session

reporting-hierarchy

Who this agent reports to (PM agent)

codebase-context

Key modules, architecture overview

custom-rules

Per-project overrides

### Architecture 1. **External template files** in `templates/` directory with variable interpolation 2. **Section registry** - config defining available sections, order, and defaults 3. **Per-project overrides** - global defaults + optional project-level config ### Out of Scope (v2) - Per-project tech-stack auto-detection - Auto-injecting framework-specific guidance ## Files Affected - NEW: `lib/AgentsMdGenerator.js` - NEW: `templates/` directory - MODIFIED: `lib/LettaService.js` (remove inline template) - MODIFIED: `lib/BeadsService.js` (remove inline template) ## Estimate ~4-6 hours

title: Replace full-table scan in BeadsBatchSync with project-scoped query
description:
## Problem

In lib/beads/BeadsBatchSync.js line 72, the batch sync function calls db.getAllIssues() which loads ALL issues across ALL projects, even though only one project is being synced.

### Current code (line 72):
```js
const dbIssues = db.getAllIssues();  // SELECT * FROM issues ORDER BY identifier
const beadsIdToDbIssue = new Map(
  dbIssues.filter(i => i.beads_issue_id).map(i => [i.beads_issue_id, i])
);
```

Good: it caches in a Map (no N+1). Bad: fetches 1000+ rows when only 50 are relevant.

## Fix

Option A — Use project-scoped query (db.getProjectIssues already exists)
Option B — Add getIssuesWithBeadsId() to IssueRepository for SQL-level filtering

## Files to modify
- lib/beads/BeadsBatchSync.js (line 72)
- Optionally: lib/database/repositories/IssueRepository.js

## Verification
- npx vitest run tests/unit/BeadsService.test.js
- npx vitest run tests/unit/BeadsParentChildService.test.js

title: [Epic] CodePerceptionModule - Real-Time Knowledge Graph Syncer
description:
## Objective
Implement a real-time Code Perception module that watches local project codebases, indexes changes, and pushes structural/semantic definitions to the Graphiti Knowledge Graph.

## Problem
The Graphiti Knowledge Graph becomes stale immediately after code changes. Agents querying the graph for 'Project Architecture' get outdated answers, leading to hallucinations during development tasks.

## Solution
Integrate a Real-Time Code Watcher into VibeSync that:
1. Watches file events (chokidar)
2. Parses code using Tree-sitter (via CocoIndex patterns)
3. Performs atomic upserts to Graphiti EntityNodes representing the code

## Graphiti API Endpoints (Confirmed LIVE)
- `POST /entity-node` - Create/upsert file or symbol entities
- `PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary` - Update existing node summaries
- `POST /api/tools/prune-missing` - Soft-delete removed files
- `GET /api/utils/uuid` - Deterministic UUID generation
- `GET /api/utils/edge-uuid` - Edge UUID generation
- `POST /messages` - Add narrative context (commit messages)

## Implementation Phases
1. GraphitiClient adapter (lib/GraphitiClient.js)
2. CodePerceptionWatcher service (lib/CodePerceptionWatcher.js)
3. Configuration and integration
4. Testing and validation

## Success Metrics
- Graph reflects code changes within <5 seconds of file save
- Agent can answer questions about new code immediately
- Zero race conditions during rapid editing
close_reason: Epic complete. All subtasks implemented: GraphitiClient.js, CodePerceptionWatcher.js, config integration, and deployment verified.

title: Add idle-data timeout to matrix-client SSE streaming
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-918

The matrix-client SSE streaming to Letta has no idle-data timeout. LETTA_STREAMING_TIMEOUT=3600s is a total timeout, but if the Letta agent hangs (sends keepalive pings but zero data chunks), the connection stays open indefinitely, locking the room for all subsequent messages. Need: (1) idle data timeout ~120s - if no real data chunk arrives for N seconds, cancel and unlock room. (2) Log the cancellation for tracking which agents hang. Root cause discovered during PM work loop testing - room was stuck for ~1h48m.

title: Fix: Ensure Project entity exists before creating file edges
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-905

## Problem

We create File entities and then try to create `Project:MXSYN → File:...` edges, but the Project entity may not exist. All edges fail with "source_node_uuid not found".

## Expected Behavior

Ensure Project entity exists (upsert it) before creating Project→File edges.

## Files Affected

- `lib/CodePerceptionWatcher.js` - `processChanges()` method

## Investigation Notes

Around line 455 we DO upsert project entity, but need to verify:

1. Is the upsert actually succeeding?
2. Is it happening before edge creation?
3. Is there a race condition?

## Suggested Fix

1. Verify project entity upsert completes successfully before proceeding
2. Add error handling if project upsert fails
3. Consider caching project entity UUIDs to avoid repeated lookups

title: Integrate auto-provisioning into ProjectSyncWorkflow INIT phase
description:
Modify ProjectSyncWorkflow to automatically provision PM agents for new projects.

Requirements:
- Only trigger if project has filesystem_path (gate condition from PM)
- Check if agent exists using checkAgentExists activity
- If not exists, call ProvisionSingleAgentWorkflow as child workflow
- Update database with updateProjectAgent activity
- Non-blocking on failure: if provisioning fails, log warning and continue sync
- Must be idempotent

Implementation:
In INIT phase, after extracting gitRepoPath:
1. If gitRepoPath exists, check agent
2. If agent missing, provision via child workflow
3. Update database
4. Continue with normal Vibe project setup

Dependencies: bd-h90r, bd-r8ur

title: [Epic] Parent-Child Issue Relationship Sync
description:
Huly Issue: HVSYN-191

## Overview

Implement bidirectional sync of parent-child issue relationships between Huly and Vibe Kanban.

## Current State

### Huly

- Issues can have sub-issues (parent-child relationships)
- Sub-issues are linked via `attachedTo` field
- Visible in issue details as "Sub-issues" section

### Vibe Kanban

- Tasks have `parent_task_attempt` field linking to a TaskAttempt
- This creates hierarchy: Parent Task → TaskAttempt → Child Tasks
- API endpoint: `GET /task-attempts/:id/children` returns `TaskRelationships`
- Can set `parent_task_attempt` when creating/updating tasks

## Proposed Solution

### Phase 1: Huly→Vibe Parent-Child Sync

1. When syncing a Huly issue with sub-issues:
   - Create parent task in Vibe
   - Create a "virtual" task attempt for the parent
   - Create child tasks with `parent_task_attempt` pointing to that attempt
2. Store parent-child mappings in sync database

### Phase 2: Vibe→Huly Parent-Child Sync

1. Detect Vibe tasks with `parent_task_attempt` set
2. Create corresponding sub-issues in Huly
3. Handle orphaned children (parent deleted)

### Phase 3: Bidirectional Consistency

1. Handle parent-child relationship changes
2. Handle re-parenting (moving child to different parent)
3. Handle parent deletion (what happens to children?)

## Technical Considerations

- Vibe's model uses TaskAttempt as intermediary, Huly uses direct parent-child
- May need to create "synthetic" task attempts in Vibe for Huly parents
- Database schema may need `parent_huly_id` and `parent_vibe_id` columns

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Huly sub-issues appear as child tasks in Vibe
- [ ] Vibe child tasks appear as sub-issues in Huly
- [ ] Parent-child relationships survive round-trip sync
- [ ] Deleting parent handles children appropriately
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] New tests cover parent-child sync scenarios

Root cause: transactor WebSocket connections time out intermittently, causing the REST API health check to pass while requests hang indefinitely. Impact: Phase 3b batch syncs fail, full sync cycles abort, webhook processing stalls. Workaround: manual docker restart of huly-test-huly-rest-api-1 (and sometimes all transactors). Needs investigation into transactor connection pooling and REST API health check accuracy.

title: Implement CodePerceptionWatcher.js - Real-time code file watcher
description:
## Task
Create a CodePerceptionWatcher service that watches project files and syncs structural/semantic data to Graphiti.

## Architecture
```
FileWatcher (chokidar)
    → Debounce (2s)
    → Parse & Extract (Tree-sitter/regex)
    → Hash Delta Check
    → GraphitiClient API Calls:
        • POST /entity-node (new files/symbols)
        • PATCH /nodes/{uuid}/summary (updates)
        • POST /api/tools/prune-missing (deletes)
```

## Implementation Details

### File Watching
- Extend existing FileWatcher.js pattern
- Use chokidar for file system events
- Debounce 2s to ensure writes are complete
- Respect .gitignore patterns

### Code Parsing
Phase 1: Simple file-level entities
- Entity name: `File:{relative_path}`
- Summary: First N chars of file + language detection

Phase 2 (Future): Symbol extraction
- Parse classes, functions using Tree-sitter
- Create `Symbol:{name}` entities
- Create DEFINES edges from File → Symbol

### Hash Delta Check
- Compute MD5 hash of file content
- Compare with previous sync state
- Skip unchanged files (avoid redundant API calls)

### Burst Protection
- Batch changes during git checkout (1000+ files)
- Chunk POST /entity-node calls (batches of 50)
- Single POST /api/tools/prune-missing at end

## Event Flow
1. Developer saves `src/user_manager.py`
2. chokidar fires FILE_MODIFIED event
3. Wait 2s debounce
4. Parse file, extract summary
5. Check hash - if changed:
   a. Compute UUID: `getEntityUUID('File:src/user_manager.py')`
   b. Call `upsertEntity(uuid, name, summary)`
6. On file delete:
   a. Collect active files
   b. Call `pruneDeletedFiles(activeFiles)`

## Configuration
```javascript
{
  graphiti: {
    enabled: process.env.GRAPHITI_ENABLED === 'true',
    apiUrl: process.env.GRAPHITI_API_URL || 'http://localhost:8003',
    groupId: process.env.GRAPHITI_GROUP_ID, // e.g., 'vibesync_project_huly-vibe-sync'
  },
  codePerception: {
    debounceMs: 2000,
    batchSize: 50,
    maxFileSizeKb: 500,
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] File add/change/delete events processed correctly
- [ ] Debouncing works (2s window)
- [ ] Hash delta check prevents redundant syncs
- [ ] Burst protection handles git checkout
- [ ] Integration with GraphitiClient works end-to-end
